metadata.title: AI-Enhanced ML-FAANG Mastery Plan
metadata.description: 20-week comprehensive roadmap for ML researchers transitioning to FAANG software engineering roles with AI-powered learning assistance

week.title: Final Projects & Production Optimization
objectives: Complete and deploy a final, high-impact portfolio project
Deeply understand MLOps and the lifecycle of production models
Practice advanced system design concepts for massive scale
Solidify behavioral stories related to end-to-end project ownership

morning_session.title: Final Project Scoping & MLOps
activities: Define the architecture for a final capstone project (e.g., a real-time feature store)
Research MLOps best practices for deployment, monitoring, and CI/CD
Use AI to create a detailed project plan with milestones

problems.name: Design Bounded Blocking Queue
problems.description: Essential for producer-consumer problems in data pipelines.

problems.name: Web Crawler
problems.description: Tests multi-threading and concurrent data access.

evening_session.title: Capstone Project: Backend Setup
activities: Set up the boilerplate for your final project (e.g., FastAPI/Flask backend)
Implement the core data models and API endpoints
Write initial unit tests with AI-generated cases

morning_session.title: Code Optimization Strategies
activities: Study memory optimization techniques in Python (e.g., generators, slots)
Use AI to explain latency vs. throughput trade-offs
Research profiling tools to identify performance bottlenecks

problems.name: Cherry Pickup
problems.description: Advanced 3D DP optimization with path constraints.

problems.name: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV
problems.description: DP with state machine or transaction limits.

evening_session.title: Capstone Project: Core Logic
activities: Implement the core, performance-critical logic of your project
Profile your code to find and eliminate bottlenecks
Use AI to suggest and explain code optimizations

morning_session.title: Large-Scale System Design Principles
activities: Study distributed system concepts: CAP theorem, consensus (Paxos/Raft)
Use AI to explain different data partitioning strategies (sharding, replication)
Review system design for services like Twitter, Uber, or Netflix

problems.name: Design a Logging System
problems.description: Production logging system with focus on scalability and real-time processing.

problems.name: Design a Rate Limiter
problems.description: Not on LeetCode, but a common system design question. Tests understanding of different algorithms (token bucket, leaky bucket).

evening_session.title: Capstone Project: Scalability
activities: Integrate a caching layer (e.g., Redis) into your project
Containerize your application using Docker
Draft a plan for how your system would scale to 1 million users

morning_session.title: Behavioral: End-to-End Ownership
activities: Draft STAR stories specifically about project challenges, from conception to completion.
Focus on stories about debugging, handling production issues, and making critical trade-offs.
Use AI to role-play an interview where you must defend your project's architecture.

problems.name: Maximal Rectangle
problems.description: Combines dynamic programming and stack-based histogram solution.

problems.name: Trapping Rain Water II
problems.description: 2D version of the classic problem, requires a priority queue.

evening_session.title: Capstone Project: Deployment
activities: Deploy your project to a cloud service (e.g., AWS, GCP, Vercel)
Set up basic CI/CD using GitHub Actions
Write a comprehensive README with architecture diagrams and setup instructions

morning_session.title: Review and Retrospective
activities: Review all the hard problems solved this week
Identify any remaining weak areas in algorithms or system design
Use AI to create a final, focused study plan for Week 19

problems.name: Design a Distributed Message Queue
problems.description: A deep system design question focusing on reliability, scalability, and durability. (e.g., SQS/Kafka)

evening_session.title: Week 19 Prep
activities: Finalize your project presentation deck
Prepare for the final mastery assessments in Week 19
Relax and mentally recharge for the final push

saturday.title: Final Project Technical Deep Dive
saturday.description: Present your final, deployed capstone project as if you were presenting to an engineering team at a FAANG company. Focus on the 'why' behind your technical decisions, the challenges you overcame, and the impact of your work.
tasks: Deliver a 25-minute presentation covering the problem, architecture, trade-offs, and results.
Conduct a live demo of the deployed application.
Answer deep-dive questions from a mock interview panel (peers or AI).
Write a blog post summarizing the project.
saturday.deliverable: A deployed web service, a public GitHub repo with a high-quality README, and a recorded presentation.

sunday.title: Advanced System Design Study
sunday.description: Solidify your understanding of large-scale system design by studying and diagramming a complex, real-world system. Choose a system you're interested in, such as Google Photos, Netflix's video encoding pipeline, or Amazon's fulfillment network.
tasks: Read engineering blogs and papers about your chosen system.
Create a detailed architecture diagram using a tool like Excalidraw or Mermaid.js.
Identify the key bottlenecks and how the system addresses them.
Use AI to compare the system's design with alternative approaches.
sunday.deliverable: A detailed system design document, including an architecture diagram and an analysis of key trade-offs.

ai_prompts.text: Help me optimize my Week 18 technical portfolio for maximum impact. Guide me in showcasing both ML expertise and software engineering skills effectively.
Assist me in demonstrating technical leadership through my portfolio projects. Help me craft compelling narratives that show innovation, problem-solving, and impact.
Guide me through advanced technical presentation skills. Help me communicate complex technical concepts clearly and persuasively to different audiences.
